cast.name: 瓦伦蒂娜·乌沙科娃 Valentina Ushakova
纳塔利娅·谢列兹尼奥娃 Natalya Seleznyova
尼古拉·克留奇科夫 Nikolai Kryuchkov
埃拉斯特·加林 Erast Garin
瓦西里·舒克申 Vasili Shukshin

director.name: 鲍里斯·巴尔涅特 Boris Barnet

introduction: Kazakhstan, the 50s. The main heroine of the film is a nine-year-old girl Alyonka, who was sent to town to study by her parents. The girl meets various companions on her long way. The story is told on her behalf about people cultivating the virgin land, their joys and sorrows, dreams and troubles.Set in 1955 when many migrated from Russia to the Steppes of Kazakhstan, this is the trip back to the Canal from the frontier and farms by a number of people who tell their settler stories. Alenka Muratova (Ovodova) is a winsome 13 year old who talks Dmitry Prokovich, the chief mechanic for the Soviet, into giving up his seat in the truck to a young mother with her infant daughter. Then Alenka and Dmitry share the back of the open truck with a young woman, newly graduated dentist who has not been able to find a position, Stefan, a hitchhiker with a dog who hopes his upper-class wife will return to him and the countryside, and Vasselina Petrovolka, a woman who lost one of her twin daughters in a riding accident by the river shortly after they arrived, and now is returning to tell the other twin of her sister's fate. A warm hearted look at common folks traveling in the frontier.
